intro: Byrsonima intermedia, commonly known as Brazilian cherry or *pata de vaca*, is a deciduous tree native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The tree produces edible fruits that are rich in vitamin C and are used in traditional medicine. Its bark and leaves contain compounds with potential anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in forested areas.
